decks.notes: This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize. The deck includes efficient creatures with haste and pump spells to increase their damage output, along with direct damage spells to clear the way for attacks or finish off the opponent. The mana base is optimized for quick plays and smooth curves, allowing the deck to apply pressure early and maintain aggression throughout the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the battlefield by using counterspells, board wipes, and card draw to maintain card advantage and dominate the late game. It also includes a companion to enhance the deck's strategy. The mana base is focused on ensuring consistency and the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils to further control the game. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through superior card advantage and control.

The key concept of this Aggro - Arclight Phoenix deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells, enabling the recursion of Arclight Phoenix to pressure the opponent. Utilizing card draw and low-cost spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe, the deck aims to cast multiple spells in a turn to bring back Arclight Phoenix and deal significant damage. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Picklock Prankster and Spikefield Hazard to control the board and protect the Phoenix's attacks. With a focus on efficiency and graveyard synergy, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures.

The main idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly equip its creatures with powerful equipment like Colossus Hammer and Shadowspear to deal massive damage to opponents. The deck also includes protection spells like Portable Hole and Hardlight Containment to ensure the creatures stay on the battlefield. With cards like Nahiri, Heir of the Ancients and Sigarda's Aid to support the strategy, along with creatures like Cloud, Midgar Mercenary and Kazuul's Toll Collector to provide additional pressure, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and efficient aggression.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from exile. It utilizes cheap spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse for removal while using draw spells like Treasure Cruise and Consider to fuel the Phoenix's revival. Picklock Prankster and Artist's Talent help generate extra value. The lands are a mix of red and blue sources for consistency. The deck aims to be aggressive and tempo-focused, using efficient spells to control the board while setting up the Phoenix for explosive damage potential.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly equipping creatures with powerful artifacts like Colossus Hammer and Shadowspear to deal massive damage to opponents. It also includes a mix of creatures and spells that provide additional support and protection to ensure a strong offense. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, aggressive attacks while maintaining board control through a variety of equipment and creature abilities. By efficiently utilizing equipment and creature synergies, this deck aims to dominate the battlefield and secure swift victories.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board using a combination of removal spells and disruptive creatures, while also applying pressure with evasive threats. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan and Faerie Miscreant to draw cards, the deck aims to maintain a tempo advantage. Cards like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Moon-Circuit Hacker provide powerful threats that can quickly close out the game. The deck also includes versatile cards like Brazen Borrower and Enduring Curiosity to adapt to different situations.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells. The deck includes powerful attackers like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board. Duress and Thoughtseize help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provides additional card advantage. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy to secure a fast victory.

The deck focuses on setting up a powerful combo between Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II, utilizing cards like Monument to Endurance and Seasoned Hallowblade to protect and support the combo. The deck also includes cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize for removal and disruption, as well as lands like Godless Shrine and Concealed Courtyard for mana fixing. The strategy involves setting up the combo pieces while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a game-winning combo turn.

This deck revolves around assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo, utilizing cards like Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to generate powerful synergy and overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes key support cards such as Monument to Endurance, Seasoned Hallowblade, and Thoughtseize to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By carefully combining these cards and managing resources effectively, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominating board presence and secure victory through a devastating combo finish.

This deck focuses on using the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to generate powerful synergies and overwhelming board presence. By utilizing cards like Fleeting Spirit and Seasoned Hallowblade for evasion and protection, the deck aims to control the game while setting up its combo pieces. With removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, along with disruption from cards like Thoughtseize, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building towards its combo win condition. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's strategy and ensure consistency in its plays.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a mixture of creatures and removal spells in the Rakdos color combination. It aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress while using efficient removal like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to maintain board control. The deck includes powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Bloodtithe Harvester to quickly close out the game. The land base is optimized for consistent mana production and the inclusion of Mutavault provides additional creature pressure. The deck is designed to end the game quickly and decisively.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with low-cost creatures and aggressive spells to quickly deal damage and gain board control. With a mix of efficient creatures like Novice Inspector and Venerated Loxodon, alongside removal spells like Gleeful Demolition and Portable Hole, the deck aims to continuously apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining board presence. The inclusion of cards like Needleverge Pathway and Sacred Foundry helps to ensure consistent mana production for a smooth curve of threats. Overall, the deck aims to establish dominance early in the game and push for a quick victory.

This deck focuses on exploiting the graveyard mechanics of Arclight Phoenix to quickly fill the graveyard with spells and bring back the Phoenix for repeated aggressive damage. It also includes card draw and removal spells to control the board and outpace the opponent. The key strategy is to use cheap spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of hasty flying attackers and disruptive spells. The deck aims to be fast and efficient, putting pressure on the opponent early and maintaining momentum throughout the game.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Mutavault to apply pressure early on. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's board. The deck features powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Graveyard Trespasser to close out games. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive strategy, with cards like Blightstep Pathway and Blackcleave Cliffs providing the necessary colors. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast creatures and efficient removal spells.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly by playing aggressive and efficient green creatures. The deck utilizes devotion to green to maximize the power of cards like Steel Leaf Champion and Old-Growth Troll. By ramping up with mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with creatures like Werewolf Pack Leader and Rhonas the Indomitable. Collected Company helps to further flood the board with creatures, while Tribute to the World Tree provides additional utility and resilience. The key strategy is to maintain pressure and dominate the battlefield.
